the Dwarf in ''[[The Hobbit]]'': Along with his brother Gloin, Oin is a distant cousin of Thorin Oakenshield. A brave Northern Dwarf, Oin joins The Company of Thorin Oakenshield out of a sense of loyalty to his kin, and also because he has a substantial sum of money invested in the venture. Well read with an enquiring mind, Oin is the healer among the Company, often applying an herbal salve of his own invention – which has since come to be known as ‘ointment’ after its maker.

{{disambig-two: :Perhaps the oldest of the 13 Dwarves (next to Balin), Óin is also hard of hearing, as he carries an ear trumpet (which got trodden on by a [[Orcs
the Dwarf in ''[[The Hobbit]]'': Goblin]] in [[Goblin-town]] when the company was captured, though he mostly manages to bend it back into its original shape after their escape).  Because of the fact that he was the group's de facto medicine man (and also presumably due to his older age), he opts to stay behind in [[Lake-town]] (along with [[Fíli]]) to look after [[Kíli]] when [[Thorin]] deems him too ill (from having been struck by a poisoned arrow) to accompany the group on the final leg of their quest up to the Lonely Mountain.  He is in awe of [[Tauriel]]'s Elvish healing powers when she ultimately heals Kíli's wound.
